Classification Name: Data from database: Food Prices for Nutrition

Country Name: The cost of a healthy diet indicator is the cost of purchasing the least expensive locally available foods to meet requirements for energy and food-based dietary guidelines (FBDGs), in current PPP$/person/day, for a representative person within energy balance at 2330 kcal/day. Data available for 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021. PPPs in 2018, and/or 2019, and/or 2020, and/or 2021 are imputed by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations for the given countries of Argentina, Aruba, Bermuda, British Virgin Islands, Cayman Islands, Curaçao, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Dominica, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, Eswatini, Gabon, Kazakhstan, Liberia, Malawi, Myanmar, Sao Tome and Principe, Senegal, Seychelles, Sint Maarten (Dutch part), Suriname, Tajikistan, United Arab Emirates and Zimbabwe.
Country Code: Adapted from Herforth, A., Venkat, A., Bai, Y., Costlow, L., Holleman, C. & Masters, W.A. 2022. Methods and options to monitor globally the cost and affordability of a healthy diet. Background paper for The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2022. Rome, FAO.
